ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about the plays covered in class as well as a wealth of background knowledge about the circumstances that surrounded each play.

I gained a lot of wonderful new insights into plays I have always loved from Professor Kastan. I looked forward weekly to his seminars and my readings of the plays benefited so much from his phenomenal knowledge and understanding of the texts (although this almost goes without saying).
I learned how to read in a manner that wasnt just superficial, to gain understanding that extends beyond the actions of the play.

Well, it was a strange semester since Professor Bloom passed away halfway through, which was really very unfortunate and tragic. Fortunately though, Professor Kastan stepped in with aplomb and he's a gem. I just wish it wasn't in such unfortunate circumstances.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought it was great! It would be nice if 100% of your grade wasn't riding on the final paper though.

An obvious strength was how seamlessly Professor took over from Professor Bloom, and made the best of a terrible situation to continue to make the course engaging and fulfilling. It feels irrelevant to comment on weaknesses as any issues were fairly unique to this one situation and unavoidable.
I thought it was difficult to discuss and gain a deep understanding of the plays when there were two or even 3 a week.
The passing of Professor Bloom halfway through was unfortunate.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would. This was an amazing way to learn about Shakespeare
Yes! Professor David Kastan took over the course and breathed new life into it. It was superb! I learned so much about the plays we covered.
Yes, take any class you can with Professsor Kastan. His understanding of Shakespeare is unparalleled and yet he remains approachable and accessible if you need feedback or support.
I would recommend it as long as they had an appreciation for Shakespeareits fun when you like reading his plays and discussing them.
